metadata.name: The Maker
metadata.description:
Street cobblers are informal workers very common in west African cities. 
These itinerant shoemakers, though cheap workers, are masters of their craft and manage with very small equipment to mend, repair and polish worn-out shoes. 
They crisscross through neighborhoods, sometimes under harsh weather conditions, offering their services to inhabitants and earning just enough to fulfill their daily needs.  
_________________________________________________________________________________


Life is a reality to be experienced.  
Though many realities seem "unfair"  
Every reality requires the same virtue.  
Courage.
